channel.title: Fire fox
channel.description: ok my dad was using my comp last ngiht(checking hsi email) he was trying to log out of it but it wouldent. of couse he blames it on fire fox(he hates it and like IE) and says it "dosent behave like a browser should" and that its much worse than IE. my question is.. why is fire fox more liked than IE(i know tabs and such but IE has them now..) is it faster..because i havent realy noticed a diference. i personaly like it more because it looks better.

item.title: Fire fox
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Mopman, post:10, topic:89253”][quote author=The Un-Named link=topic=130523.msg1264546#msg1264546 date=1178336373]
Did you know, Firefox performs much better on systems with not a lot of memory than IE does?
[/quote]

Actually, I wouldn’t be so sure. Firefox has some mad memory leaks and generally makes bad use of memory, it’s almost as bad as Windows Live Messenger for using 10x the amount of RAM it should be using.[/quote]

IE7 Uses more memory than Firefox for me, it’s 84mb for me(2gb total) and I have 40~ tabs open.

Read full topic

item.title: Fire fox
item.dc:creator: @XxKanexX Kane.
item.description:
@XxKanexX wrote:

[quote=“Aftermath, post:11, topic:89253”]Yeah, it regularly used somewhere around 200 MB of memory for me, and only went up the longer it was running.

Internet Explorer and Opera manage to do it for me with around 35 MB of memory.[/quote]
FF stays on around 50MB for me…

Read full topic

item.title: Fire fox
item.dc:creator: @Aftermath_961 Aftermath
item.description:
@Aftermath_961 wrote:

Yeah, it regularly used somewhere around 200 MB of memory for me, and only went up the longer it was running.

Internet Explorer and Opera manage to do it for me with around 35 MB of memory.

Read full topic

item.title: Fire fox
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

The Un-Named:

Did you know, Firefox performs much better on systems with not a lot of memory than IE does?

Actually, I wouldn’t be so sure. Firefox has some mad memory leaks and generally makes bad use of memory, it’s almost as bad as Windows Live Messenger for using 10x the amount of RAM it should be using.

Read full topic

item.title: Fire fox
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Criptic:

IE is noob frendly and its the primary browser on new computers

Actually, no. Dell are planning on selling computers with linux pre-installed, so the default browser depends on the linux distro.

Read full topic

item.title: Fire fox
item.dc:creator: @hodunken hodunken
item.description:
@hodunken wrote:

I use fire fox… but really, who gives a fuck?
if it gets to the web site you want it to go to then why does it matter?
more secure? maybe, but if someone wants to hack your system, they will hack your system. simple change in the bowser you use isn’t going to do much.
but i just like Firefox because the add-ons…I don’t think it really matters

Read full topic

item.title: Fire fox
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

Tell your dad he’s a moron that believes everything what microsoft says.

Did you know, Firefox 0.90~ was more secure than what IE6 ever was? Did you know, Firefox performs much better on systems with not a lot of memory than IE does?

Vista and IE7 where made for stupid rich fucks with $10k to spend on PC’s, while Firefox users don’t generally have bad pc’s it runs fine on 256mb ram where IE7 rapes it.

Read full topic

It’s not more liked, most people use IE.
It’s just that noobs who use FF spam it louder than people who use IE.
